intro: Ruilopezia hanburyana, commonly known as the Hanbury's grass, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andes mountains in South America. It belongs to the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, tufted growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, greenish-white flowers. Ruilopezia hanburyana is typically found in high-altitude grasslands and is adapted to cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
